Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding to help defray the expenses of participants in two meetings of the "Northeast Analysis Network," the first of which will be held September 23-24, 2016, on the campus of the University of Rochester and the second of which will be held September 22-23, 2017, on the campus of Syracuse University.

The Northeast Analysis Network (NAN) will bring together once a year, for the coming two years, the analysis communities in the state of New York and neighboring states. The University of Rochester and Syracuse University will each host one conference (Rochester: NAN 2016; Syracuse: NAN 2017). Each conference will primarily feature talks by senior post-docs and finishing graduate students who are about to enter the job market. A magnet lectures by a leading researcher, the "Excelsior Lecture" (named after the motto of the state of New York) will serve as a catalyst for each conference. The Excelsior Lecturers are Jill Pipher (NAN 2017) and Svitlana Mayboroda (NAN 2017).

POR.DRECONTENT:
This conference award supported three conferences in the ``Northeast Analysis Network (NAN)?? series, which took place Sept. 9-10 at the University of Rochester (NAN 2016); Sept. 22-23 at Syracuse University (NAN 2017), and September 14-15 at the University at Albany SUNY (NAN 2018). Outcomes are as follows:

 

(1) Each conference hosted a two-part distinguished lecture by a prominent mathematician, the ``Excelsior Lecturer?? ? specifically: NAN 2016: Jill Pipher (Brown University) gave a two-parts lecture on ``Elliptic and Parabolic Boundary Value Problems??. NAN 2017: Svitlana Mayboroda (University of Minnesota) gave a two-part lecture on ``Harmonic Measure and Rectifiability??. NAN 2018: Alice Chang (Princeton University) gave a two-part lecture  on ``A fourth Order PDE and applications to Conformal Geometry??.

 

(2) In each conference, the Excelsior Lectures were complemented by several 20-minute research talks , the greatest majority of which were given by  emerging junior mathematicians (post-docs or tenure-track assistance professors, and finishing PhD students.

 

(3) A few of the contributed talks given at NAN 2017 will be published in a dedicated volume of the peer-reviewed professional journal CASY (Complex Analysis and its Synergies):

 

Complex Analysis and its Synergies | Home

 

 It is anticipated that the research talks given at NAN 2016 and NAN 2018 will also be published in peer-reviewed professional journals. However in view of the long processing times for journal publications, there is no mechanism in place to keep track of such publications other than the subscription-based, national database ``Mathematical Reviews?? managed by the American Mathematical Society: 

 

MR: Search Authors database

 

Further activities supported by this award included

 

(4) A series of hands-on workshops, each two hour long, aiming to improve the participants grant-writing skills. 

 

All details, including: speakers? names and affiliations; workshop activities and resources, are available on the Northeast Analysis Network?s website:
